rule.description: This panel allows the user to set general parameters that apply to all rules.

param.label: Units
param.name: UNITS
param.description: Allows the user to select the units that will be used for all the various rule parameters involving distances. The default unit is mils, but if this units parameter is changed, then all of the values using these units will be converted to the new units.

param.label: Individual HTML Output Files
param.name: INDIVIDUAL FILES
param.description: Allows the user the option to create an individual HTML output file for each rule.

rule.longname: Critical Net Crossing Split Reference Plane
rule.description: Critical nets must not cross a split in the adjacent reference plane. Notes: 1. Any crossing of an adjacent plane by a critical net will cause a violation. 2. A crossing is allowed if two stitching capacitors (one on either side of the crossing point) are within a specified distance of the crossing.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Max Allowable Distance from Net Crossing to Stitching Caps
param.name: MAX DIST FROM GAP TO CAP
param.description: Two stitching capacitors must be found within this distance of the point where the net crosses a split in its reference plane.

param.label: Max Allowable Return Current Diversion
param.name: MAX TRACE DIST FROM GAP PT TO GAP PT
param.description: If a signal's return current can divert itself around the gap in the reference plane, the total distance of the diversion must be less than this value.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Only Identify Gaps Between Planes on Same Layer
param.name: ONLY CHECK GAPS ON THE SAME LAYER
param.description: This option allows the user to choose whether gaps are only between planes on the same layer or not. When the rule tries to pair up nearby plane boundary crossing points and identify gaps, this parameter will enable/disable a check for layer commonality.

param.label: Recognize Dual Plane Reference Within
param.name: ALLOW DIST VARIATION
param.description: Instructs EMI Scannner to consider both planes as a reference when checking for gap crossing when the distance difference to each plane is less than the specified distance. This allows recognition of both planes as references for strip line traces when the trace is offset from the exact center by a small amount (normally for manufacturing reasons).

param.label: Max Distance Between Crossing Points for Combination as Single Gap
param.name: MAX SEARCH DIST FROM GAP 1 TO GAP 2
param.description: The rule will try to combine nearby crossing points into a single violation (e.g. the entrance and exit of a gap between planes). Setting this parameter to a large value could cause the algorithm to pair up unrelated crossing points, and setting this parameter to a small value can prevent crossing points from being paired up, which will result in more violations. It is recommended to set the value to a reasonable distance based on the board design technology being used (e.g. slightly larger than the typical plane separation within a layer).

param.label: Suppress Violation for Traces Connected to Via in Gap
param.name: SUPPRESS VIA IN GAP VIO
param.description: Instructs EMI Scannner to ignore trace crossing split/gap when connected to a via within that gap.

param.label: Max Distance from Reference Plane for Via in Gap
param.name: VIO IF GAP TO VIA DIST GREATER THAN
param.description: Violation will not be suppressed (from above) for vias within gap if the trace extends greater than the specified distance from edge of the reference plane to the via.

param.label: Net Choice
param.name: NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis. Select 1 or more from list.

rule.description: Critical nets must not change reference planes. Notes: 1. Any change in reference plane for a critical net will cause a violation. 2. Part A - Reference plane changing is allowed if the specified number (default 2) of decoupling capacitors (or vias if the planes are the same net) are within the specified 'smaller' radius from the signal via where the signal changes reference planes. 3. Part B - Reference plane changing is allowed if the specified number (default 3) of decoupling capacitors (or vias if the planes are the same net) are within the specified 'larger' radius from the signal via where the signal changes reference planes. 4. Part C - Reference plane changing can be ignored when the initial via is within a specified distance from its IC pin (transmit or receive).

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Sort Changing Reference Violation by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN A
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results for Part A(any net changing reference plane). Select from pull-down menu.

param.label: Sort Capacitor/Via Violation by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN B
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results for Part B (reference changes without adequate decoupling). Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Sort Overused Via Violation by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN C
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results for Part C (overused return vias). Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Overused Return Vias
param.name: CHECK FOR OVER USED VIAS
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check for overused return vias. Overused Return Vias = 'no' means that EMI Scannner will ignore this check.

param.label: Max Current Limit
param.name: MAX CURRENT LIMIT
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum number of signal currents that a return via should carry. Use this setting if Overused Vias is selected.

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Recognize Dual Plane Reference Within
param.name: ALLOW DIST VARIATION
param.description: Instructs EMI Scannner to consider both planes as a reference when checking for trace changing reference planes when the distance difference to each plane is less than the specified distance. This allows recognition of both planes as references for strip line traces when the trace is offset from the exact center by a small amount (normally for manufacturing reasons).

param.label: Allow Partial Reference Plane Change
param.name: ALLOW PARTIAL REFERENCE PLANE CHANGE
param.description: Instructs EMI Scannner to ignore violation if one of the two reference planes remains a reference plane on both sides of the via transition.

param.label: Check for Plane Decoupling
param.name: CHECK FOR PLANE DECOUPLING
param.description: Instructs EMI Scannner to ignore violation if a decoupling capacitor exists between the two reference planes (entering reference plane and leaving reference plane) and is within a specified distance (below) from the signal via.

param.label: Include ALL Reference Plane Changes
param.name: SHOW ALL VIA REFERENCE PLANE CHANGES
param.description: Instructs EMI Scannner (when 'yes' is selected) to display all reference plane changes. When there are two associated reference planes for the entry to the via, and two different associated reference planes for the trace leaving the via, selecting 'yes' will show two violations for this transition. Note: if 'no' is selected, and a decoupling capacitor exists between one of the entering reference planes and one of the leaving reference planes (within the specified distance), no violation will be reported, even though the two other reference planes do not have any connection.

param.label: Number of Vias Allowed on Net
param.name: NUMBER OF ALLOWED VIAS ON NET
param.description: Allows user to specify the number of via reference plane changes that are allowed on critical nets. Note: if no vias are desired except the 'escape' via close to the IC, then set this parameter to zero, and set the next parameter to 'yes'.

param.label: Allow Via Close to IC
param.name: ALLOW A VIA CLOSE TO AN IC
param.description: Allows user to ignore vias that are close to the IC and are required to get a trace from the surface to an inner layer. The user selects the maximum distance this ignored via may be from the IC in the next parameter.

param.label: Max Distance from IC to Ignored Via
param.name: MAX DISTANCE FROM IC TO VIA
param.description: Allows user to ignore vias within the specified distance from an IC.

param.label: Use Point-to-Point Distance from IC to Via
param.name: USE DIRECT DISTANCE FOR IC TO VIA DIST
param.description: If 'yes' is selected, the actual trace path length is NOT calculated. While this option will allow EMI Scannner rule checking to run faster, if traces are not run directly from IC to via, violations may be ignored incorrectly.

param.label: Allow Via Connection Between Reference Planes
param.name: ALLOW VIA STITCHING IF SAME POTENTIAL
param.description: Allows a via to be used to connect reference planes (to provide return current path) when the two reference planes are the same net name.

param.label: Allow Complex Via Connections (Jogging) Between Planes
param.name: CHECK FOR VIA JOG
param.description: Allows a set of vias (e.g. 'blind' vias which do not extend through all of the layers) to be used to connect reference planes (to provide return current path) when the two reference planes are the same net name. This advanced checking requires extra processing time, because all vias found in the larger via radius are considered as potential paths.

param.label: Num of Decoupling Caps Required Within Smaller Radius
param.name: NUM OF DECOUPLING CAPS WITHIN CLOSER CAP DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. This parameter allows the user to specify the number of decoupling capacitors within the smaller radius.

param.label: Num of Vias Required Within Smaller Radius
param.name: NUM OF CONNECTING VIAS WITHIN CLOSER VIA DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. Typically, a via between planes is considered a lower impedance/inductance connection than a decoupling capacitor, and so the user may wish to specify this differently than the decoupling capacitor option. This parameter allows the user to specify the number of vias within the smaller radius.

param.label: Small Radius Allowable Capacitor Distance
param.name: CLOSER CAP DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. This parameter allows the user to specify the smaller radius that must contain the required number of capacitors (from #11 above).

param.label: Small Radius Allowable Via Distance
param.name: CLOSER VIA DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. This parameter allows the user to specify the smaller radius that must contain the required number of vias (from #12 above).

param.label: Num of Decoupling Caps Required Within Larger Radius
param.name: NUM OF DECOUPLING CAPS WITHIN FURTHER CAP DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. This parameter allows the user to specify the number of decoupling capacitors within the larger radius.

param.label: Num of Vias Required Within Larger Radius
param.name: NUM OF CONNECTING VIAS WITHIN FURTHER VIA DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. Typically, a via between planes is considered a lower impedance/inductance connection than a decoupling capacitor, and so the user may wish to specify this differently than the decoupling capacitor option. This parameter allows the user to specify the number of vias within the larger radius.

param.label: Large Radius Allowable Capacitor Distance
param.name: FURTHER CAP DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. This parameter allows the user to specify the smaller radius that must contain the required number of capacitors (from #15 above).

param.label: Large Radius Allowable Via Distance
param.name: FURTHER VIA DIST
param.description: A return current path (when a critical net changes reference planes) may be provided with either capacitors or vias (when 'yes' is selected in #10 above). The user may specify a required number of either capacitors or vias within a specified smaller radius, or, if this requirement is not met, a larger radius may be specified for a larger number of decoupling capacitors or vias. This parameter allows the user to specify the smaller radius that must contain the required number of vias (from #16 above).

param.label: Additional Search Range Percent
param.name: ADDITIONAL SEARCH RANGE PERCENT
param.description: Allows the user to specify an additional search range beyond the larger radius for additional capacitors. For example, if the Large-Radius is set to 500 mils, and the Additional Search range at 100%, EMI Scannner will report capacitors within 1000 mils when a violation occurs.

param.label: Force All Plane Combinations to Be Decoupled
param.name: FORCE ALL PLANE COMBINATIONS TO BE DECOUPLED
param.description: Consider the following stackup: Assume the net references V02/V03 when on layer S02 and V04/V05 when on S04 (see diagram below). V02 -------------------- S02 ------+ V03 -----------|-------- S03 | V04 -----------|-------- S04 +----- V05 -------------------- For this case, you can have the tool either look for decaps connecting V02<->V04 and V03<->V05 or have it look for V02<->V04, V02<->V05, V03<->V04, and V03<->V05. By default, it will look for 1st ref layer to 1st ref layer and 2nd ref layer to 2nd ref layer (V02<->V04, V03<->V05). If you want the tool to decouple all ref plane combinations, set this value to YES.

param.label: Net Choice
param.name: NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.longname: Critical Net Near Edge of Reference Plane
rule.description: Critical nets may not be within a specified distance of the edge of their reference plane. Notes: 1. Specified distance from edge of plane may be different for external and internal signal layers. 2. Distance to edge of board may be checked instead of edge of plane. 3. Edge connector traces may be ignored.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Min Distance from Edge Required for External Signal Layers
param.name: CLOSEST DISTANCE OF SEG ON EXTERNAL LAYER
param.description: Allows the user to specify what minimum distance must exist between the edge of the reference plane and a critical signal net when the net is on an external layer.

param.label: Min Distance from Edge Required for Internal Signal Layers
param.name: CLOSEST DISTANCE OF SEG ON INTERNAL LAYER
param.description: Allows the user to specify what minimum distance must exist between the edge of the reference plane and a critical signal net when the net is on an internal layer.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Use Edge of Board (Instead of Edge of Plane)
param.name: CHECK TO EDGE OF BOARD INSTEAD OF PLANE
param.description: Allows users to check distance from critical nets to the edge of the board instead of the edge of the reference plane. This can be useful if the board is only partially complete, and all reference planes are not yet completed.

param.label: Check All Plane Edges
param.name: CHECK ANY PLANE EDGE
param.description: Allows users to check the distance from nets to any edge of their reference plane, rather than limiting the check to reference plane edges near the edge of the board.

param.label: Ignore Violation If Net Approaches Edge at 90 Degrees +/-
param.name: NO VIOLATION IF SEG APPROACH IS 90 DEGREES +-
param.description: Allows users to ignore edge connectors, etc. which approach the edge of the reference plane (or board) at a 90 degree angle. The tolerance specified in this option allows the approach to be slightly off a perfect 90 degrees.

param.label: Check Nets on External Layers
param.name: CHECK EXTERNAL NETS
param.description: Allows the user to specify if nets on external layers should be checked in this rule.

param.label: Check Nets on Internal Layers
param.name: CHECK BURIED NETS
param.description: Allows the user to specify if nets on internal layers should be checked in this rule.

param.label: Minimum Net Segment Length for Violation
param.name: MINIMUM SEG LENGTH TO CAUSE VIOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to specify the minimum net segment length before EMI Scannner will report a violation if the net is within the specified distance from the edge of the reference plane (or board).

param.label: Recognize Dual Plane Reference Within
param.name: ALLOW DIST VARIATION
param.description: Instructs EMI Scannner to consider both planes as a reference when checking for traces too close to the edge of the reference planes when the distance difference to each plane is less than the specified distance. This allows recognition of both planes as references for strip line traces when the trace is offset from the exact center by a small amount (normally for manufacturing reasons).

param.label: Net Choice
param.name: NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.description: Critical nets may not be routed within a specified distance of an I/O net. Notes: 1. Class of I/O net can be specified.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Min Required Distance Between Critical Net and I/O Net
param.name: REQUIRED DIST FROM IO NET TO CRIT NET
param.description: Allows the user to specify the minimum distance between all critical nets and all I/O nets.

param.label: I/O Nets Class to Include
param.name: IO NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of I/O Nets to include in this rule analysis. Class 1L: low speed intentional signals that leave the shielded enclosure Class 1H: high speed intentional signals that leave the shielded enclosure Class 2: signals that leave the board on a cable and remain within the shielded enclosure Class 3: signals that leave the board directly to another board and remain within the shielded enclosure

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Min I/O Net Segment Length to Check
param.name: MIN IO SEG LENGTH TO CAUSE VIOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to specify the smallest I/O net segment length to check for violations. All I/O net segments smaller than this specified length will be ignored by EMI Scannner.

param.label: Min Critical Net Segment Length to Check
param.name: MIN CRIT SEG LENGTH TO CAUSE VIOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to specify the smallest critical net segment length to check for violations. All critical net segments smaller than this specified length will be ignored by EMI Scannner.

param.label: Check Nets on Different Layers
param.name: APPLY CHECK ACROSS LAYERS
param.description: Allows the user to check distance between I/O nets and critical nets when these nets are on different layers, and between the same pair of planes.

param.label: Check I/O Components
param.name: CHECK IO COMPONENTS
param.description: Allows the user to specify that any I/O component that is within the specified distance from a critical net will cause a violation.

param.label: Check Nets that are Both I/O and Critical
param.name: CHECK NETS THAT ARE I/O AND CRITICAL
param.description: Allows the user to specify that nets labeled as both critical and I/O should be checked for distance from other I/O nets.

param.label: Ignore Violations If Net Approaches Edge at 90 Degrees +/-
param.name: NO VIOLATION IF SEG APPROACH IS 90 DEGREES +-
param.description: Allows users to ignore edge connectors, etc. which approach the edge of the reference plane (or board) at a 90 degree angle. The tolerance specified in this option allows the approach to be slightly off a perfect 90 degrees.

param.label: Suppress Multiple Violations for Same Net-to-Net Vio
param.name: OUTPUT ONLY ONE VIOLATION FOR MULTIPLE IO SEGS TO CRIT SEGS VIOLATIONS
param.description: Allows the user to suppress multiple violation reporting when multiple segments on a critical net infringe on the same I/O net.

param.label: Report Violation Only Once per I/O Component
param.name: OUTPUT ONLY THE FIRST COMPONENT VIOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to reduce run time by only checking for violations between critical nets and I/O components when no other violation has been found for an I/O component.

param.label: Critical Net Choice
param.name: CRITICAL NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.description: All critical nets must be buried between solid planes. The allowable length of the exposed portion of a critical net may be specified.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Maximum Exposed Critical Net Segment Length
param.name: MAX DIST OF SEG NET ON OUTSIDE LAYER
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum critical net segment length allowed on external (exposed) layers.

param.label: Total Maximum Exposed Critical Net Length
param.name: MAX DIST OF NET AN OUTSIDE LAYER
param.description: Allows the user to specify the total maximum critical net length allowed on external (exposed) layers. For example, multiple segments on a critical net may be exposed, but short enough to not cause a violation individually.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column to sort the results on. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Net Choice
param.name: NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.description: All critical nets must have a ground-guard trace on either side of the critical net. Notes: 1. Vacant track isolation may be used in place of ground-guard traces.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Vacant Track Isolation Allowed
param.name: VACANT TRACK ISOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to specify that vacant tracks (empty space) may be used in place of ground-guard traces.

param.label: Minimum Isolation Distance Required
param.name: MIN ISOLATION DISTANCE FROM CRITICAL NET
param.description: Allows the user to select the minimum distance required between critical nets and all other nets before EMI Scannner reports a violation. This parameter is used if Vacant Track Isolation Allowed = 'yes'.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Minimum Critical Net Segment Length
param.name: MIN SEG LENGTH TO CAUSE VIOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to ignore short critical net segments.

param.label: Max Distance between Vias on Ground-Guard Traces
param.name: MIN VIA TO VIA DISTANCE ON GROUND GUARD TRACE
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum distance between vias (connected to 'ground') on ground-guard traces.

param.label: Ignore Violations If Approach Angle is 90 Degrees +/-
param.name: NO VIOLATION IF SEG APPROACH IS 90 DEGREES +-
param.description: Allows users to ignore net segments that approach each other at (or near) a 90 degree angle. The tolerance specified in this option allows the approach to be slightly off a perfect 90 degrees.

param.label: Critical Net Choice
param.name: CRITICAL NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.description: All critical differential nets must have a ground-guard trace on either side of the differential pair of nets. Notes: 1. Vacant track isolation may be used in place of ground-guard traces.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Vacant Track Isolation Allowed
param.name: VACANT TRACK ISOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to specify that vacant tracks (empty space) may be used in place of ground-guard traces.

param.label: Minimum Isolation Distance Required
param.name: MIN ISOLATION DISTANCE FROM CRITICAL NET
param.description: Allows the user to select the minimum distance required between critical nets and all other nets before EMI Scannner reports a violation. This parameter is used if Vacant Track Isolation Allowed = 'yes'.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Max Distance Between Complementary Nets
param.name: DISTANCE FROM ONE DIFF NET TO THE OTHER
param.description: Allows the user to set a maximum spacing between a pair of critical nets (creating a critical differential pair).

param.label: Minimum Critical Net Segment Length
param.name: MIN SEG LENGTH TO CAUSE VIOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to ignore short critical net segments.

param.label: Max Distance between Vias on Ground-Guard Traces
param.name: MIN VIA TO VIA DISTANCE ON GROUND GUARD TRACE
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum distance between vias (connected to 'ground') on ground-guard traces.

param.label: Ignore Violations If Approach Angle is 90 Degrees +/-
param.name: NO VIOLATION IF SEG APPROACH IS 90 DEGREES +-
param.description: Allows users to ignore net segments that approach each other at (or near) a 90 degree angle. The tolerance specified in this option allows the approach to be slightly off a perfect 90 degrees.

param.label: Critical Net Choice
param.name: CRITICAL NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.longname: Critical Differential Net Length Matching and Spacing
rule.description: All critical differential nets must be routed within a specified distance of each other, and the length of the differential pair of nets must match within a specified amount.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Max Distance Between Complementary Nets
param.name: DISTANCE FROM ONE DIFF NET TO THE OTHER
param.description: Allows the user to set a maximum spacing between a pair of critical nets (creating a critical differential pair).

param.label: Maximum Length Mismatch
param.name: DIFFERENTIAL PAIR LENGTH MISMATCH DISTANCE
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum difference in length between a critical differential pair of nets.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Min Critical Net Segment Length
param.name: MIN SEG LENGTH TO CAUSE VIOLATION
param.description: Allows the user to ignore short critical net segments.

param.label: Critical Net Choice
param.name: CRITICAL NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.description: All power and ground traces longer than a specified distance should be wider than another specified distance. This does not include grounded guard traces.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Min Power/Ground Trace Width
param.name: MIN POWER GROUND TRACE WIDTH
param.description: Allows the user to set a minimum width limit for all power/ground traces (except grounded guard traces).

param.label: Min Power/Ground Trace Length
param.name: POWER GROUND TRACE LENGTH
param.description: Allows the user to ignore short power/ground traces.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

rule.description: Decoupling capacitors must be placed between all adjacent plane pairs within a specified grid density. Notes: 1. Decoupling between power/ground-reference pairs may be selected instead of decoupling between adjacent pairs of planes. 2. The number of decoupling capacitors required within each grid location can be adjusted. 3. A via may connect planes of same net name instead of a capacitor.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Check Only for Pwr-to-Gnd Plane Decoupling
param.name: ONLY POWER TO GROUND DECOUPLING
param.description: Allows the user to only check for decoupling capacitors between power and ground planes. Selecting this option will ignore plane-to-plane decoupling.

param.label: Grid Size (X Direction)
param.name: GRID WIDTH
param.description: The size of the grid EMI Scannner uses to check for decoupling capacitors may be specified by the user. This parameter specifies the x-direction grid size.

param.label: Grid Size (Y Direction)
param.name: GRID HEIGHT
param.description: The size of the grid EMI Scannner uses to check for decoupling capacitors may be specified by the user. This parameter specifies the y-direction grid size.

param.label: Number of Decoupling Caps Required within Each Grid
param.name: NUM OF DECAPS REQUIRED PER GRID
param.description: Allows the user to specify the number of decoupling capacitors connecting between planes that EMI Scannner will require within each grid location.

param.label: Number of Vias Required within Each Grid
param.name: NUM OF VIAS REQUIRED PER GRID
param.description: Allows the user to specify the number of vias connecting between planes that EMI Scannner will require within each grid location. This parameter is only active when Advanced parameter #2 (below) is 'yes'.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Allow Via Connection for Same Net Name
param.name: CONNECTING VIA FOR SAME POTENTIAL
param.description: This parameter allows the user to specify to allow a via in place of a decoupling capacitor when the two planes are the same net name.

param.label: Include Power/Ground Islands on Signal Layers
param.name: CHECK POWER ISLANDS
param.description: Allows the user to include all power/ground islands when checking for decoupling capacitors. Selecting 'no' will not check for decoupling on these power/ground islands.

param.label: Check Only When Grid on Board by at Least
param.name: CHECK ONLY IF GRID IS ON THE BOARD BY AT LEAST
param.description: Allows the user to check a grid when at least the specified grid percentage is on the board. This allows small portions of the board (that may occur when the grid size is not an integer increment of the board size), to be ignored.

param.label: Ignore Violations from Pwr/Gnd Nets with Same Name
param.name: SUPPRESS VIOS FROM SAME NETS
param.description: This allows the user to select that only one plane of a given name is checked for violations. For example, if two planes are "gnd", then if a violation occurred between gnd and another layer, only one violation would be reported.

param.label: Require One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid
param.name: COMPONENT PIN MUST BE INSIDE GRID
param.description: Allegro sometimes defines a component's boundary box too large. Since the rule is looking for whether the component falls inside the grid or outside the grid, this can lead to the rule thinking that a component is inside the grid when it is in fact outside the grid (but its boundary box still falls at least partially inside the grid). The user can change how EMI Scannner determines whether the component is inside or outside the grid in one of three ways: a) Treat the component as inside the grid if any pin of the component is inside the grid: Set: " Require One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = no b) Treat the component as inside the grid only if all the pins on the component are inside the grid: Set: " Require One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = yes c) Treat the component as inside the grid if the component's boundary box intersects the grid: Set: " Require One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = no and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = yes or no

param.label: Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid
param.name: ALL COMPONENT PINS MUST FALL INSIDE GRID
param.description: Allegro sometimes defines a component's boundary box too large. Since the rule is looking for whether the component falls inside the grid or outside the grid, this can lead to the rule thinking that a component is inside the grid when it is in fact outside the grid (but its boundary box still falls at least partially inside the grid). The user can change how EMI Scannner determines whether the component is inside or outside the grid in one of three ways: a) Treat the component as inside the grid if any pin of the component is inside the grid: Set: " Require One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = no b) Treat the component as inside the grid only if all the pins on the component are inside the grid: Set: " Require One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = yes c) Treat the component as inside the grid if the component's boundary box intersects the grid: Set: " Require One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = no and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = yes or no

param.label: Layer Choice
param.name: LAYER LISTING
param.description: Specifies the Layers to include in this rule analysis.

rule.longname: Decoupling Capacitor Distance from IC Power Pin
rule.description: A decoupling capacitor must be connected between the power and ground-reference planes and be placed within a specified distance from each IC power pin. Notes: 1. Capacitors may be limited to one side of the board or not.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Max Distance between Decoupling Cap and IC Power Pin
param.name: MAX DISTANCE BETWEEN DECOUPLING CAP AND IC POWER PIN
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum distance between an IC power pin and its decoupling capacitor.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Maximum Search Distance for Cap
param.name: MAX SEARCH BOX FOR CAPS
param.description: Allows the user to specify a maximum search distance for a cap. A larger search box increases the chances of EMI Scannner finding caps, but can slow down the processing time of the rule.

param.label: Allow Capacitors on Both Sides of Board
param.name: CHECK CAPS ON WRONG SIDE OF BOARD
param.description: Allows the user to include capacitors on both sides of the board to satisfy this rule.

param.label: Require Only One Cap Pin to be Within Specified Distance
param.name: COMPONENT PIN MUST BE INSIDE BOX
param.description: Allegro sometimes defines a component's boundary box too large. Since the rule is looking for whether the capacitor falls within a specified distance from the IC power pin, this can lead to the rule thinking that a capacitor is meets this requirement when it does not really meet the requirement. The user can change how EMI Scannner determines whether the capacitor meets the requirement in one of three ways: a) Treat the capacitor as meeting the requirement if any pin of the capacitor is within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Capacitor Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = no b) Treat the capacitor as meeting the requirement if all pins of the capacitor are within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Capacitor Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = yes c) Treat the capacitor as meeting the requirement if the capacitor's boundary box meets the requirement: Set: " Require Only One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = no and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = yes or no

param.label: Require ALL Cap Pins to be within Specified Distance
param.name: ALL COMPONENT PINS MUST FALL INSIDE BOX
param.description: Allegro sometimes defines a component's boundary box too large. Since the rule is looking for whether the capacitor falls within a specified distance from the IC power pin, this can lead to the rule thinking that a capacitor is meets this requirement when it does not really meet the requirement. The user can change how EMI Scannner determines whether the capacitor meets the requirement in one of three ways: a) Treat the capacitor as meeting the requirement if any pin of the capacitor is within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Capacitor Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = no b) Treat the capacitor as meeting the requirement if all pins of the capacitor are within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Capacitor Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = yes c) Treat the capacitor as meeting the requirement if the capacitor's boundary box meets the requirement: Set: " Require Only One Capacitor Pin to be Inside Grid " = no and " Require ALL Capacitor Pins to be Inside Grid " = yes or no

param.label: ICs to Check
param.name: IC COMPONENT LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Components to include in this rule analysis.

rule.longname: IC Power/Ground-Reference Pin Distance to Via
rule.description: The trace connecting between the IC power or ground-reference pin and the associated via to the power/ground-reference plane must be no longer than the specified distance.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Maximum Distance between IC Pin and Via
param.name: MAX PATH LENGTH FROM PIN TO VIA
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum distance between the IC power or ground-reference pin and the via to the power or ground-reference plane.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Maximum Search Distance for Via
param.name: MAX SEARCH BOX FOR VIAS
param.description: Allows the user to specify a maximum search distance for a via, when a violation is found. This allows the user to quickly determine if the via is barely outside the original requirement, and therefore not a serious violation.

param.label: Apply Rule to Power Pins
param.name: APPLY RULE TO POWER PINS
param.description: You can force the rule to not check the power pins by setting the next parameter to NO.

param.label: Apply Rule to Ground Pins
param.name: APPLY RULE TO GROUND PINS
param.description: You can force the rule to not check the ground pins by setting the next parameter to NO.

param.label: Check Power/Ground Pins Without Plane
param.name: APPLY RULE TO POWER PIN WITHOUT REF PLANE
param.description: Allows the user to check the distance between the IC power/ground pin and its via when the power/ground plane has not been completed yet.

param.label: Verify Via Connected to Appropriate Plane
param.name: VERIFY VIA CONNECTED TO REFERENCE SHAPE
param.description: Allows the user to speed up EMI Scannner checking by not verifying that the via connects to the appropriate plane (shape).

rule.description: The traces connecting between a decoupling capacitor and its associated vias to the power/ground-reference planes must be no longer than the specified distance.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Maximum Distance Between Capacitor and Via
param.name: MAX PATH LENGTH FROM PIN TO VIA
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum distance between the capacitor pin and the via to the power or ground-reference plane.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Maximum Search Distance for Via
param.name: MAX SEARCH BOX FOR VIAS
param.description: Allows the user to specify a maximum search distance for a via, when a violation is found. This allows the user to quickly determine if the via is barely outside the original requirement, and therefore not a serious violation.

param.label: Verify Via Connected to Appropriate Plane
param.name: VERIFY VIA CONNECTED TO REFERENCE SHAPE
param.description: Allows the user to speed up EMI Scannner checking by not verifying the via connects to the appropriate plane (shape).

rule.description: All power and ground-reference traces longer than a specified length that provide power to a fast switching chip must have a decoupling capacitor within a specified distance from the IC power pin.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Maximum Ignorable Power/Ground Trace Length
param.name: POWER GROUND TRACE LENGTH
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum allowable power/ground trace length that may be ignored. All traces longer than this length must meet this rule's requirement.

param.label: Max Distance between Cap and IC Power Pin
param.name: MAX DIST CAP PIN TO POWER PIN
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum distance between the capacitor pin and the power or ground-reference pin.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Net Choice
param.name: NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of Nets to include in this rule analysis.

rule.description: This rule checks for power planes that do not have enough adjacent layer via connections.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Minimum Number of Vias
param.name: MIN_VIAS_THRESHOLD
param.description: Minimum number of vias required to connect adjacent power planes.

param.label: Use Grid
param.name: GRID REQUIRED
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will require the vias to be distributed across a grid. State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will only consider the number of vias.

param.label: Grid Size (X Direction)
param.name: GRID WIDTH
param.description: The size of the grid EMI Scannner uses to check for vias may be specified by the user. This parameter specifies the x-direction grid size.

param.label: Grid Size (Y Direction)
param.name: GRID HEIGHT
param.description: The size of the grid EMI Scannner uses to check for vias may be specified by the user. This parameter specifies the y-direction grid size.

param.label: Number of Vias Required within Each Grid
param.name: NUM OF VIAS REQUIRED PER GRID
param.description: Allows the user to specify the number of vias connecting between planes that EMI Scannner will require within each grid location. This parameter is only active when Advanced parameter #2 (below) is 'yes'.

param.label: Check Only When Grid on Board by at Least
param.name: CHECK ONLY IF GRID IS ON THE BOARD BY AT LEAST
param.description: Allows the user to check a grid when at least the specified grid percentage is on the board. This allows small portions of the board (that may occur when the grid size is not an integer increment of the board size), to be ignored.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Hidden Debug switch
param.name: CR_PV_DEBUG
param.description: For testing.

rule.description: This rule checks for overlapping reference planes from different domains.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Maximum Total Overlap Area
param.name: MAX OVERLAP
param.description: The maximum total area of all regions of overlap between nets of group A and group B.

param.label: Nets to Include in Reference Group A
param.name: NET LISTING A
param.description: Specifies the a group of nets whose planes must not overlap with planes of nets in the second group.

param.label: Nets to Include in Reference Group B
param.name: NET LISTING B
param.description: Specifies the a group of nets whose planes must not overlap with planes of nets in the first group.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

rule.longname: I/O Filter Distance to I/O Connector
rule.description: All I/O filters must be placed within a specified distance of the I/O connector.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Max Distance from Filter to I/O Connector
param.name: MAX DIST FROM CONNECTOR TO FILTER OR CAP
param.description: This allows the user to specify the maximum distance a filter may be placed from the I/O connector.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORT COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: I/O Nets Class to Include
param.name: NET LISTING
param.description: Specifies the type of I/O Nets to include in this rule analysis. Class 1L: low speed intentional signals that leave the shielded enclosure Class 1H: high speed intentional signals that leave the shielded enclosure Class 2: signals that leave the board on a cable and remain within the shielded enclosure Class 3: signals that leave the board directly to another board and remain within the shielded enclosure

rule.longname: Distance from Oscillator to Clock Driver
rule.shortname: Distance from Oscillator to Clock Driver
rule.description: All oscillators must be placed within the specified distance of the clock driver (or other device) that they drive.

param.label: Rule State
param.name: RULE STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will check this rule. Rule State = 'off' means EMI Scannner will ignore this rule.

param.label: Max Distance from Oscillator to Clock Driver
param.name: MAX DIST FROM OSCILLATOR TO CLOCK DRIVER
param.description: Allows the user to specify the maximum distance between an oscillator and the clock drivers, etc. that it drives.

param.label: Sort by Column
param.name: SORTED COLUMN
param.description: Specifies the column on which to sort the results. Select from the pull-down menu.

param.label: Log File State
param.name: LOG STATE
param.description: Selects if EMI Scannner will create a log file with additional details (intended for debug use).

param.label: Weighting Factor
param.name: WEIGHTING FACTOR
param.description: Allows the user to specify the weighting factor (0<factor<=1) that is applied to violations of this rule when assigning a rank. The rank for a violation is its own "degree of badness" times the rule's weighting factor. The ranking enables a user to focus on the more serious violations first.

param.label: Require Only One Comp Pin to be Within Specified Distance
param.name: AT LEAST ONE COMPONENT PIN MUST BE INSIDE BOX
param.description: Allegro sometimes defines a component's boundary box too large. Since the rule is looking for whether the component falls within a specified distance from the oscillator, this can lead to the rule thinking that a component meets this requirement when it does not really meet the requirement. The user can change how EMI Scannner determines whether the component meets the requirement in one of three ways: a) Treat the component as meeting the requirement if any pin of the component is within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Component Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Component Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = no b) Treat the component as meeting the requirement if all pins of the component are within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Component Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Component Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = yes c) Treat the component as meeting the requirement if the component's boundary box meets the requirement: Set: " Require Only One Component Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = no and " Require ALL Component Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = yes or no

param.label: Require ALL Comp Pins to be Within Specified Distance
param.name: ALL COMPONENT PINS MUST FALL INSIDE BOX
param.description: Allegro sometimes defines a component's boundary box too large. Since the rule is looking for whether the component falls within a specified distance from the oscillator, this can lead to the rule thinking that a component meets this requirement when it does not really meet the requirement. The user can change how EMI Scannner determines whether the component meets the requirement in one of three ways: a) Treat the component as meeting the requirement if any pin of the component is within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Component Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Component Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = no b) Treat the component as meeting the requirement if all pins of the component are within the specified distance: Set: " Require Only One Component Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = yes and " Require ALL Component Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = yes c) Treat the component as meeting the requirement if the component's boundary box meets the requirement: Set: " Require Only One Component Pin to be Within Specified Distance " = no and " Require ALL Component Pins to be Within Specified Distance " = yes or no
